DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : A diet rich carotenoid may effective treatment cervical dysplasia . PURPOSE : Randomized phase II trial study effectiveness carotenoid rich diet treat patient cervical dysplasia .
DOC.brief_title: Carotenoid Rich Diet Treating Cervical Dysplasia
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Determine whether carotenoid rich diet cause significant increase regression disease patient grade I II cervical intraepithelial dysplasia . II . Determine whether regression disease patient population reflect modulation intermediate biological marker ( viral genome copy number human papilloma virus ( HPV ) HPV E6/E7 expression ) . OUTLINE : This randomize , control study . Patients randomize one two treatment arm . Arm I : Patients receive dietary counseling eat 5-10 serving carotenoid rich fruit vegetable day year . Arm II : Patients receive counsel maintain normal diet . Carotenoid level , HPV status , progression cervical dysplasia , diet ( food frequency checklist food diary ) monitor group . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 240 patient accrue study within 5 year .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Histologically proven cervical intraepithelial dysplasia , grade CIN II , CIN I repeat cytology No invasive carcinoma Pap smear No positive endocervical curettage PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : 18 55 ( premenopausal ) Performance status : Not specify Life expectancy : Not specify Hematopoietic : Not specify Hepatic : Not specify Renal : Not specify Other : No concurrent beta carotene supplement Not pregnant nursing No prior malignancy PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy : Not specify Chemotherapy : Not specify Endocrine therapy : Not specify Radiotherapy : Not specify Surgery : At least 6 month since prior cauterization , cryosurgery , laser , conization cervix
